verses.translation: By those [angels] lined up in rows
And those who drive [the clouds]
And those who recite the message,
Indeed, your God is One,

verses.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَیۡنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَشَـٰرِقِ
verses.translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.
verses.transliteration: Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa wa Rabbul mashaariq

verses.arabic: إِنَّا زَیَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَاۤءَ ٱلدُّنۡیَا بِزِینَةٍ ٱلۡكَوَاكِبِ
verses.translation: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars
verses.transliteration: Innaa zaiyannas samaaa 'ad dunyaa bizeenatinil kawaakib

verses.translation: And as protection against every rebellious devil
verses.transliteration: Wa hifzam min kulli Shaitaanim maarid

verses.arabic: لَّا یَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ وَیُقۡذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبࣲ
verses.translation: [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,
verses.transliteration: Laa yassamma 'oona ilal mala il a'alaa wa yuqzafoona min kulli jaanib

verses.translation: Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,

verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ خَطِفَ ٱلۡخَطۡفَةَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابࣱ ثَاقِبࣱ
verses.translation: Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].
verses.transliteration: Illaa man khatifal khatfata fa atba'ahoo shihaabun saaqib

verses.arabic: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَهُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَم مَّنۡ خَلَقۡنَاۤۚ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَـٰهُم مِّن طِینࣲ لَّازِبِۭ
verses.translation: Then inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created men from sticky clay.
verses.transliteration: Fastaftihim ahum ashaddu khalqan am man khalaqnaa; innaa khalaqnaahum min teenil laazib

verses.translation: But you wonder, while they mock,
And when they are reminded, they remember not.
And when they see a sign, they ridicule
verses.transliteration: Wa izaa ra aw Aayatinw yastaskhiroon

verses.arabic: وَقَالُوۤا۟ إِنۡ هَـٰذَاۤ إِلَّا سِحۡرࣱ مُّبِینٌ
verses.translation: And say, "This is not but obvious magic.
verses.transliteration: Wa qaalooo in haazaa illaa sihrum mubeen

verses.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابࣰا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ
verses.translation: When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
verses.transliteration: 'A-izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaabanw wa 'izaaman 'ainnaa lamab'oosoon

verses.translation: And our forefathers [as well]?"
Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."

verses.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِیَ زَجۡرَةࣱ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣱ فَإِذَا هُمۡ یَنظُرُونَ
verses.translation: It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.
verses.transliteration: Fa innamaa hiya zajra tunw waahidatun fa izaa hum yanzuroon

verses.translation: They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."
verses.transliteration: Qa qaaloo yaa wailanaa haazaa Yawmud-Deen

verses.arabic: هَـٰذَا یَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ٱلَّذِی كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
verses.translation: [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."
verses.transliteration: Haazaa Yawmul Faslil lazee kuntum bihee tukaziboon

verses.arabic: ۞ ٱحۡشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِینَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزۡوَ ٰ⁠جَهُمۡ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ یَعۡبُدُونَ
verses.translation: [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds, and what they used to worship
verses.transliteration: Uhshurul lazeena zalamoo wa azwaajahum wa maa kaanoo ya'budoon

verses.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهۡدُوهُمۡ إِلَىٰ صِرَ ٰ⁠طِ ٱلۡجَحِیمِ
verses.translation: Other than Allah, and guide them to the path of Hellfire
verses.transliteration: Min doonil laahi fahdoohum ilaa siraatil Jaheem

verses.translation: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
[They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
But they, that Day, are in surrender.
And they will approach one another blaming each other.

verses.arabic: قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَأۡتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلۡیَمِینِ
verses.translation: They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."
The oppressors will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,

verses.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَیۡكُم مِّن سُلۡطَـٰنِۭۖ بَلۡ كُنتُمۡ قَوۡمࣰا طَـٰغِینَ
verses.translation: And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.
verses.transliteration: Wa maa kaana lanaa 'alaikum min sultaanim bal kuntum qawman taagheen

verses.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَیۡنَا قَوۡلُ رَبِّنَاۤۖ إِنَّا لَذَاۤىِٕقُونَ
verses.translation: So the word of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.
Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.

verses.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوۤا۟ إِذَا قِیلَ لَهُمۡ لَاۤ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ یَسۡتَكۡبِرُونَ
verses.translation: Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allah," were arrogant
verses.transliteration: Innahum kaanooo izaa qeela lahum laaa ilaaha illal laahu yastakbiroon

verses.arabic: وَیَقُولُونَ أَىِٕنَّا لَتَارِكُوۤا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرࣲ مَّجۡنُونِۭ
verses.translation: And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
verses.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona a'innaa lataarikooo aalihatinaa lishaa'irim majnoon

verses.translation: Rather, the Prophet has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
verses.transliteration: bal jaaa'a bilhaqqi wa saddaqal mursaleen

verses.translation: Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,

verses.arabic: وَمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
verses.translation: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
verses.transliteration: Wa maa tujzawna illaa maa kuntum ta'maloon

verses.translation: But not the chosen servants of Allah.
Those will have a provision determined -
Fruits; and they will be honored
In gardens of pleasure
On thrones facing one another.
There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
White and delicious to the drinkers;

verses.arabic: لَا فِیهَا غَوۡلࣱ وَلَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا یُنزَفُونَ
verses.translation: No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
verses.transliteration: Laa feehaa ghawlunw wa laa hum 'anhaa yunzafoon

verses.translation: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances, with large, [beautiful] eyes,
As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.
And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

verses.arabic: قَالَ قَاۤىِٕلࣱ مِّنۡهُمۡ إِنِّی كَانَ لِی قَرِینࣱ
verses.translation: A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth]
verses.transliteration: Qaala qaaa'ilum minhum innee kaana lee qareen

verses.translation: Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe

verses.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابࣰا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِینُونَ
verses.translation: That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"
verses.transliteration: 'A-izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaabanw wa 'izaaman 'ainnaa lamadeenoon

verses.translation: He will say, "Would you [care to] look?"
And he will look and see him in the midst of the Hellfire.
verses.transliteration: Fattala'a fara aahu fee sawaaa'il Jaheem

verses.translation: He will say, "By Allah, you almost ruined me.

verses.arabic: وَلَوۡلَا نِعۡمَةُ رَبِّی لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُحۡضَرِینَ
verses.translation: If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].
verses.transliteration: Wa law laa ni'matu Rabbee lakuntu minal muhdareen

verses.translation: Then, are we not to die

verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَوۡتَتَنَا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِینَ
verses.translation: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"
verses.transliteration: Illa mawtatanal oola wa maa nahnu bimu'azzabeen

verses.translation: Indeed, this is the great attainment.
For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.

verses.arabic: أَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ خَیۡرࣱ نُّزُلًا أَمۡ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
verses.translation: Is Paradise a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqum?
verses.transliteration: Azaalika khairun nuzulan am shajaratuz Zaqqom

verses.translation: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.

verses.arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةࣱ تَخۡرُجُ فِیۤ أَصۡلِ ٱلۡجَحِیمِ
verses.translation: Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,
verses.transliteration: Innahaa shajaratun takhruju feee aslil Jaheem

verses.translation: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.

verses.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِنۡهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ
verses.translation: And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.
verses.transliteration: Fa innahum la aakiloona minhaa famaali'oona minhal butoon

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمۡ عَلَیۡهَا لَشَوۡبࣰا مِّنۡ حَمِیمࣲ
verses.translation: Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.
verses.transliteration: Summa inna lahum 'alaihaa lashawbam min hameem

verses.translation: Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.
verses.transliteration: Summa inna marji'ahum la ilal Jaheem

verses.translation: Indeed they found their fathers astray.
So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.
And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad dalla qablahum aksarul awwaleen

verses.translation: And We had already sent among them warners.
Then look how was the end of those who were warned -
But not the chosen servants of Allah.
And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad naadaanaa Noohun falani'mal mujeeboon

verses.translation: And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.
verses.transliteration: Wa jajainaahu wa ahlahoo minal karbil 'azeem

verses.translation: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]
And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Noah among the worlds."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
Then We drowned the disbelievers.
And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,
verses.transliteration: Wa ina min shee'atihee la Ibraaheem

verses.translation: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart
verses.transliteration: Iz jaaa'a Rabbahoo bi qalbin saleem

verses.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِیهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
verses.translation: [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?
verses.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi wa qawmihee maazaa ta'budoon

verses.translation: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allah you desire?
Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"
And he cast a look at the stars
And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
So they turned away from him, departing.

verses.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰۤ ءَالِهَتِهِمۡ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
verses.translation: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?
verses.transliteration: Faraagha ilaaa aalihatihim faqaala alaa taakuloon

verses.translation: What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"
And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.
Then the people came toward him, hastening.
He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
While Allah created you and that which you do?"

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱبۡنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنۡیَـٰنࣰا فَأَلۡقُوهُ فِی ٱلۡجَحِیمِ
verses.translation: They said, "Construct for him a furnace and throw him into the burning fire."
verses.transliteration: Qaalub noo lahoo bun yaanan fa alqoohu fil jaheem

verses.translation: And they intended for him a plan, but We made them the most debased.
verses.transliteration: Fa araadoo bihee kaidan faja 'alnaahumul asfaleen

verses.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّی ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّی سَیَهۡدِینِ
verses.translation: And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.
verses.transliteration: Wa qaala innee zaahibun ilaa Rabbee sa yahdeen

verses.translation: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."
So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعۡیَ قَالَ یَـٰبُنَیَّ إِنِّیۤ أَرَىٰ فِی ٱلۡمَنَامِ أَنِّیۤ أَذۡبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا تَرَىٰۚ قَالَ یَـٰۤأَبَتِ ٱفۡعَلۡ مَا تُؤۡمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِیۤ إِن شَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِینَ
verses.translation: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion, he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, of the steadfast."
verses.transliteration: Falamma balagha ma'a hus sa'ya qaala yaa buniya inneee araa fil manaami anneee azbahuka fanzur maazaa taraa; qaala yaaa abatif 'al maa tu'maru satajidunee in shaaa'allaahu minas saabireen

verses.translation: And when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,
We called to him, "O Abraham,

verses.arabic: قَدۡ صَدَّقۡتَ ٱلرُّءۡیَاۤۚ إِنَّا كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ نَجۡزِی ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِینَ
verses.translation: You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
verses.transliteration: Qad saddaqtar ru'yaa; innaa kazaalika najzil muhsineen

verses.translation: Indeed, this was the clear trial.
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Abraham."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.
verses.transliteration: Wa bashsharnaahu bi Ishaaqa Nabiyayam minas saaliheen

verses.arabic: وَبَـٰرَكۡنَا عَلَیۡهِ وَعَلَىٰۤ إِسۡحَـٰقَۚ وَمِن ذُرِّیَّتِهِمَا مُحۡسِنࣱ وَظَالِمࣱ لِّنَفۡسِهِۦ مُبِینࣱ
verses.translation: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself.
verses.transliteration: Wa baaraknaa 'alaihi wa 'alaaa Ishaaq; wa min zurriyya tihimaa muhsinunw wa zaalimul linafshihee mubeen

verses.translation: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad mananna alaa Moosaa wa Haaroon

verses.translation: And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,
verses.transliteration: Wa najjainaahumaa wa qawmahumaa minal karbil 'azeem

verses.translation: And We supported them so it was they who overcame.
And We gave them the explicit Scripture,
And We guided them on the straight path.
And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Moses and Aaron."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,
When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allah?
Do you call upon Ba'l and leave the best of creators -
verses.transliteration: Atad'oona Ba'lanw wa tazaroona ahsanal khaaliqeen

verses.translation: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"
verses.transliteration: Allaaha Rabbakum wa Rabba aabaaa'ikumul awwaleen

verses.translation: And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],
Except the chosen servants of Allah.
And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Elias."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.
[So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,
Except his wife among those who remained [with the evildoers].
Then We destroyed the others.
And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
And at night. Then will you not use reason?
And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.
[Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
verses.transliteration: Iz abaqa ilal fulkil mash hoon

verses.translation: And he drew lots and was among the losers.
Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.
And had he not been of those who exalt Allah,
verses.transliteration: Falaw laaa annahoo kaana minal musabbiheen

verses.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِی بَطۡنِهِۦۤ إِلَىٰ یَوۡمِ یُبۡعَثُونَ
verses.translation: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.
verses.transliteration: Lalabisa fee batniheee ilaa Yawmi yub'asoon

verses.translation: But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.
And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.

verses.arabic: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلۡفٍ أَوۡ یَزِیدُونَ
verses.translation: And We sent him to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.
verses.transliteration: Wa arsalnaahu ilaa mi'ati alfin aw yazeedoon

verses.translation: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.
verses.transliteration: Fa aamanoo famatta' naahum ilaa heen

verses.translation: So inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?
verses.transliteration: Fastaftihim ali Rabbikal banaatu wa lahumul banoon

verses.arabic: أَمۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةَ إِنَـٰثࣰا وَهُمۡ شَـٰهِدُونَ
verses.translation: Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"
verses.transliteration: Am khalaqnal malaaa'i kata inaasanw wa hm shaahidoon

verses.translation: Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,
verses.transliteration: Alaaa innahum min ifkihim la yaqooloon

verses.translation: " Allah has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.
Has He chosen daughters over sons?
What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?
Then will you not be reminded?
Or do you have a clear authority?
Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.
verses.transliteration: Faatoo bi Kitaabikum in kuntum saadiqeen

verses.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ بَیۡنَهُۥ وَبَیۡنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ نَسَبࣰاۚ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمَتِ ٱلۡجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ
verses.translation: And they have claimed between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought to [punishment].
verses.transliteration: Wa ja'aloo bainahoo wa bainal jinnati nasabaa; wa laqad 'alimatil jinnatu innahum lamuhdaroon

verses.translation: Exalted is Allah above what they describe,
Except the chosen servants of Allah [who do not share in that sin].
So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,
You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him
Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.

verses.arabic: وَمَا مِنَّاۤ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامࣱ مَّعۡلُومࣱ
verses.translation: [The angels say], "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.
verses.transliteration: Wa maa minnasa illaa lahoo maqaamum ma'loom

verses.translation: And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].
And indeed, we are those who exalt Allah."
And indeed, the disbelievers used to say,

verses.arabic: لَوۡ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكۡرࣰا مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ
verses.translation: "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,
We would have been the chosen servants of Allah."
But they disbelieved in it, so they are going to know.
And Our word has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad sabaqat Kalimatunaa li'ibaadinal mursa leen

verses.translation: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory
And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.
So, [O Muhammad], leave them for a time.
And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.
Then for Our punishment are they impatient?

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمۡ فَسَاۤءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِینَ
verses.translation: But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.
verses.transliteration: Fa izaa nazala bisaahatihim fasaaa'a sabaahul munzareen

verses.translation: And leave them for a time.
And see, for they are going to see.

verses.arabic: سُبۡحَـٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلۡعِزَّةِ عَمَّا یَصِفُونَ
verses.translation: Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.
And peace upon the messengers.
And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
